intro: Aganosma breviloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aganosma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds.
